greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of iterations of signature function required to get to [1] from partitions in Abramowitz and Stegun order.
comment: The signature function takes a partition to the partition consisting of its repetition factors.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9295 (first 25 rows).
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
example: Partition 5 in A&S order is [1,2]. Applying the signature function to this repeatedly gives [1,2] -> [1^2] -> [2] -> [1], so a(5)=3.
mathematica: Table[sig /@ Sort[Reverse /@ IntegerPartitions[n]], {n, 9}]  // Flatten (* _Robert Price_, Jun 12 2020 *)
xref: Cf. A115621, A115624, Sequence of first partitions with a(m)=n is A012257, with initial rows {1} and {2} in prepended. See A036036 for A&S partitions.
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 20 2006
